bibl.title: The Opening of Euripides' Phoenissae between Anecdotal and Textual Tradition.
bibl.note: About the two lines which open Euripides Phoinissae in the medieval manuscripts and which do not appear in three papyrus witnesses of the Roman period. - The scholium. - The negative evidence. - The positive evidence. - A new authoritative text?
bibl.seg: Chiara Meccariello, The Opening of Euripides' Phoenissae between Anecdotal and Textual Tradition.

About the two lines which open Euripides Phoinissae in the medieval manuscripts and which do not appear in three papyrus witnesses of the Roman period. - The scholium. - The negative evidence. - The positive evidence. - A new authoritative text?
